006
007package renderer.models_T;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker;
012
013/**
014   Create a solid model of a Menger Sponge centered at the origin.
015<p>
016   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menger_sponge" target="_top">
017                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menger_sponge</a>
018*/
019public class MengerSponge extends Model implements MeshMaker
020{
021   final int n;
022
023   /**
024      Create a Menger Sponge centered at the origin
025      using three recursive iterations.
026   */
027   public MengerSponge()
028   {
029      this(3);
030   }
031
032
033   /**
034      Create a Menger Sponge centered at the origin
035      using {@code n} recursive iterations.
036
037      @param n  number of recursive iterations
038      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
039   */
040   public MengerSponge(final int n)
041   {
042      super(String.format("Menger_Sponge(%d)", n));
043
044      if (n < 0)
045         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than or equal to 0");
046
047      this.n = n;
048
049      if (0 == n)
050      {
051         // Create a cube geometry.
052         addVertex(new Vertex(-1, -1, -1), // four vertices around the bottom face
053                   new Vertex( 1, -1, -1),
054                   new Vertex( 1, -1,  1),
055                   new Vertex(-1, -1,  1),
056                   new Vertex(-1,  1, -1), // four vertices around the top face
057                   new Vertex( 1,  1, -1),
058                   new Vertex( 1,  1,  1),
059                   new Vertex(-1,  1,  1));
060
061         // Create the 6 faces of the cube.
062         addPrimitive(new Triangle(0, 1, 2), // bottom face
063                      new Triangle(2, 3, 0),
064                      new Triangle(3, 2, 6), // front face
065                      new Triangle(6, 7, 3),
066                      new Triangle(2, 1, 5), // right face
067                      new Triangle(5, 6, 2),
068                      new Triangle(1, 0, 4), // back face
069                      new Triangle(4, 5, 1),
070                      new Triangle(0, 3, 7), // left face
071                      new Triangle(7, 4, 0),
072                      new Triangle(7, 6, 5), // top face
073                      new Triangle(5, 4, 7));
074      }
075      else
076      {
077         if (true) { // use "false" to erase the extra line segments
078         // create 24 vertices for 12 line segements
079         addVertex(new Vertex(-1,       -1, -1.0/3.0), // eight vertices in the bottom face
080                   new Vertex(-1,       -1,  1.0/3.0),
081                   new Vertex( 1,       -1, -1.0/3.0),
082                   new Vertex( 1,       -1,  1.0/3.0),
083                   new Vertex(-1.0/3.0, -1, -1),
084                   new Vertex( 1.0/3.0, -1, -1),
085                   new Vertex(-1.0/3.0, -1,  1),
086                   new Vertex( 1.0/3.0, -1,  1),
087                   new Vertex(-1,        1, -1.0/3.0), // eight vertices in the top face
088                   new Vertex(-1,        1,  1.0/3.0),
089                   new Vertex( 1,        1, -1.0/3.0),
090                   new Vertex( 1,        1,  1.0/3.0),
091                   new Vertex(-1.0/3.0,  1, -1),
092                   new Vertex( 1.0/3.0,  1, -1),
093                   new Vertex(-1.0/3.0,  1,  1),
094                   new Vertex( 1.0/3.0,  1,  1),
095                   new Vertex(-1, -1.0/3.0, -1), // four vertices in the back face
096                   new Vertex(-1,  1.0/3.0, -1),
097                   new Vertex( 1, -1.0/3.0, -1),
098                   new Vertex( 1,  1.0/3.0, -1),
099                   new Vertex(-1, -1.0/3.0,  1), // four vertices in the front face
100                   new Vertex(-1,  1.0/3.0,  1),
101                   new Vertex( 1, -1.0/3.0,  1),
102                   new Vertex( 1,  1.0/3.0,  1));
103
104         // Create 12 line segments.
105         addPrimitive(new LineSegment( 0,  1), // bottom face
106                      new LineSegment( 2,  3),
107                      new LineSegment( 4,  5),
108                      new LineSegment( 6,  7),
109                      new LineSegment( 8,  9), // top face
110                      new LineSegment(10, 11),
111                      new LineSegment(12, 13),
112                      new LineSegment(14, 15),
113                      new LineSegment(16, 17), // back face
114                      new LineSegment(18, 19),
115                      new LineSegment(20, 21), // front face
116                      new LineSegment(22, 23));
117         }
118
119         addNestedModel(subSponges(n - 1, -1, -1, -1),
120                        subSponges(n - 1, -1, -1,  1),
121                        subSponges(n - 1, -1,  1, -1),
122                        subSponges(n - 1, -1,  1,  1),
123                        subSponges(n - 1,  1, -1, -1),
124                        subSponges(n - 1,  1, -1,  1),
125                        subSponges(n - 1,  1,  1, -1),
126                        subSponges(n - 1,  1,  1,  1));
127      }
128   }
129
130
131   /**
132      Recursive helper function.
133      <p>
134      This function builds the eight sub models needed
135      for one recusive step. These sub models will not
136      be touching each other. In order to make the wireframe
137      Menger Sponge look a bit better, we add line segments
138      that connect some of the edges between the sub models.
139
140      @param n    number of recursive iterations
141      @param pmX  plus or minus 1 for x-direction
142      @param pmY  plus or minus 1 for y-direction
143      @param pmZ  plus or minus 1 for z-direction
144      @return     {@link Model} holding sub tree of sponges
145   */
146   private Model subSponges(final int n,
147                            final int pmX, final int pmY, final int pmZ)
148   {
149      assert (n >= 0);
150
151      final Model model = new Model("Menger Sponge: level "+n+" ("+pmX+", "+pmY+", "+pmZ+")",
152                                    Matrix.translate(pmX*2.0/3.0, pmY*2.0/3.0, pmZ*2.0/3.0)
153                             .times(Matrix.scale(1.0/3.0, 1.0/3.0, 1.0/3.0)));
154
155      if (0 == n) // stop the recursion
156      {
157         // Create a cube geometry.
158         model.addVertex(new Vertex(-1, -1, -1), // four vertices around the bottom face
159                         new Vertex( 1, -1, -1),
160                         new Vertex( 1, -1,  1),
161                         new Vertex(-1, -1,  1),
162                         new Vertex(-1,  1, -1), // four vertices around the top face
163                         new Vertex( 1,  1, -1),
164                         new Vertex( 1,  1,  1),
165                         new Vertex(-1,  1,  1));
166
167         // Create the 6 faces of the cube.
168         model.addPrimitive(new Triangle(0, 1, 2), // bottom face
169                            new Triangle(2, 3, 0),
170                            new Triangle(3, 2, 6), // front face
171                            new Triangle(6, 7, 3),
172                            new Triangle(2, 1, 5), // right face
173                            new Triangle(5, 6, 2),
174                            new Triangle(1, 0, 4), // back face
175                            new Triangle(4, 5, 1),
176                            new Triangle(0, 3, 7), // left face
177                            new Triangle(7, 4, 0),
178                            new Triangle(7, 6, 5), // top face
179                            new Triangle(5, 4, 7));
180      }
181      else
182      {
183         if (true) { // provide a way to erase the extra line segments
184         // create 24 vertices for 12 line segements
185         model.addVertex(new Vertex(-1,       -1, -1.0/3.0), // eight vertices in the bottom face
186                         new Vertex(-1,       -1,  1.0/3.0),
187                         new Vertex( 1,       -1, -1.0/3.0),
188                         new Vertex( 1,       -1,  1.0/3.0),
189                         new Vertex(-1.0/3.0, -1, -1),
190                         new Vertex( 1.0/3.0, -1, -1),
191                         new Vertex(-1.0/3.0, -1,  1),
192                         new Vertex( 1.0/3.0, -1,  1),
193                         new Vertex(-1,        1, -1.0/3.0), // eight vertices in the top face
194                         new Vertex(-1,        1,  1.0/3.0),
195                         new Vertex( 1,        1, -1.0/3.0),
196                         new Vertex( 1,        1,  1.0/3.0),
197                         new Vertex(-1.0/3.0,  1, -1),
198                         new Vertex( 1.0/3.0,  1, -1),
199                         new Vertex(-1.0/3.0,  1,  1),
200                         new Vertex( 1.0/3.0,  1,  1),
201                         new Vertex(-1, -1.0/3.0, -1), // four vertices in the back face
202                         new Vertex(-1,  1.0/3.0, -1),
203                         new Vertex( 1, -1.0/3.0, -1),
204                         new Vertex( 1,  1.0/3.0, -1),
205                         new Vertex(-1, -1.0/3.0,  1), // four vertices in the front face
206                         new Vertex(-1,  1.0/3.0,  1),
207                         new Vertex( 1, -1.0/3.0,  1),
208                         new Vertex( 1,  1.0/3.0,  1));
209
210         // Create 12 line segments.
211         model.addPrimitive(new LineSegment( 0,  1), // bottom face
212                            new LineSegment( 2,  3),
213                            new LineSegment( 4,  5),
214                            new LineSegment( 6,  7),
215                            new LineSegment( 8,  9), // top face
216                            new LineSegment(10, 11),
217                            new LineSegment(12, 13),
218                            new LineSegment(14, 15),
219                            new LineSegment(16, 17), // back face
220                            new LineSegment(18, 19),
221                            new LineSegment(20, 21), // front face
222                            new LineSegment(22, 23));
223         }
224
225         model.addNestedModel(subSponges(n - 1, -1, -1, -1),
226                              subSponges(n - 1, -1, -1,  1),
227                              subSponges(n - 1, -1,  1, -1),
228                              subSponges(n - 1, -1,  1,  1),
229                              subSponges(n - 1,  1, -1, -1),
230                              subSponges(n - 1,  1, -1,  1),
231                              subSponges(n - 1,  1,  1, -1),
232                              subSponges(n - 1,  1,  1,  1));
233      }
234      return model;
235   }
236
237
238
239   // Implement the MeshMaker interface (three methods).
240   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
241
242   @Override public int getVertCount() {return n;}
243
244   @Override
245   public MengerSponge remake(final int n, final int k)
246   {
247      final int newN;
248      if (n != this.n)
249         newN = n;
250      else
251         newN = k;
252      return new MengerSponge(newN);
253   }
254}//MengerSponge
